faqBlock.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqBlock.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about our center

items.question: How to schedule a consultation?
items.answer: You can schedule a consultation through the form on our website, by phone, or by sending a request to our email. Our specialists will contact you within 24 hours to confirm your appointment.

items.question: What documents are required to participate in the programs?
items.answer: To participate in the programs, you need a passport, an application form, and, depending on the program, additional documents confirming your eligibility. You can get a complete list of documents for a specific program from our consultants.

items.question: Can I get support remotely?
items.answer: Yes, most of our consultations and programs are available in an online format. We use modern video communication tools to ensure high-quality remote interaction with our clients.

items.question: What are the benefits of membership in the center's community?
items.answer: Membership in our center's community provides access to exclusive events, discounts on paid services, the opportunity to participate in closed programs, as well as regular information newsletters and priority registration for popular events.

items.question: How to become a volunteer at the center?
items.answer: To become a volunteer, fill out the application form on our website in the "Volunteering" section. After reviewing your application, we will invite you for an interview where we will discuss possible areas of cooperation and work schedule.

questions.question: How to apply for document recognition?
questions.answer: To apply for document recognition, you need to fill out an application and provide the necessary documents to our center.

questions.question: How long does the recognition procedure take?
questions.answer: The recognition procedure takes from 30 to 45 working days from the moment of submitting a complete package of documents.

questions.question: What documents are needed for accreditation?
questions.answer: For accreditation, it is necessary to provide constituent documents, licenses, curricula and programs, as well as other documents according to the list.
